bibl.title: The Conspirator Aemilius Regulus and Seneca's Aunt's Family.
bibl.note: See pp. 380-384: identifies the elder Aemilius Rectus, Prefect of Egypt early in the reign of Tiberius, as Seneca's uncle, and the younger Aemilius Rectus, Prefect in A.D. 41-42, as Seneca's cousin.
bibl.seg: KAVANAGH Bernard J., The Conspirator Aemilius Regulus and Seneca's Aunt's Family.
See pp. 380-384: identifies the elder Aemilius Rectus, Prefect of Egypt early in the reign of Tiberius, as Seneca's uncle, and the younger Aemilius Rectus, Prefect in A.D. 41-42, as Seneca's cousin.
